schema:publisher.schema:name: University of California, Davis. General Library. Dept. of Special Collections

wine_label:marginalia: "28th April 54.   I do not know a thing about Setubal wines--one can see that this one is a very old wine. According to the label, 43 years old--Undoubtedly the volatile acidity is excessive for a muscat grape wine--and does not make it so pleasant to drink--What the [original?] acidity was, and what is due to age it is hard to tell, but I daresay the [original?] acidity was on the high side--the flavour undoubtedly detects the muscat grape--To sum up and [??] that your vintage is the same as that of the [arne?] --I think you have [?] much better M.M. Gonzales [?]"
